divs: sighting detailsi was outside waiting for the sun to set so i could observe the comet panstarrs on mar 12, 2013. the sun's lower limb had just touched the horizon(not true horizon) and the object appeared for a brief moment directly above the sun. it appeared as though two plates were facing each other with a gap in the middle, the object was well lit between the two plate shapes with a white light that extended to what would be the edge. the two plates appeared red\orange this color i beleaved to be caused by the setting sun. only thing is i didn't understand how the top plate could be colored by the sun because the sun was below it. the object was only visible for a minute or so and then just disappeared. no movement at all in any direction. interestingly this object was observed again at a different location(about 15 miles further to the west) the very next night.(today march 13,2013) in the same relative position to the sun at the same time of sun set. i first thought it might be the iss, or even a geo stationary satellite, but there was no movement. only and appearance and then just disappeared. i was a commercial pilot for over 45yrs. and quite familiar with aircraft of all(most) types. btw: i did see the comet later on after the sun had disappeared below the horizon.

Summary: Just prior to sunset waiting to observe the comet PanSTARRS the object appeared directly above the setting sun
